CatDescriptText: Mrs. Bea Johnson, 2447 Waring Court, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 14, 1958, pg. 8 with question: "Do you think ministers should invest in business enterprises for profit, or become executives or directors of such concern?" answer reads: "Yes, if he has the money to spare for the advancement and if it will be profitable for him to invest. As for hold an executive office or directorship, well that is all right also if he is qualified to do the work."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Bea Johnson, wearing eyeglasses, light colored striped button down dress with brooch, and wristwatch on left wrist, standing on Penn Avenue across from the Stanley Theatre and street car that reads "Horrell - Transport...", Downtown
